reviewText: Just thought I'd make this review for those who are shakey about buying this because they're reading the reviews about these movies not being in widescreen. Well, they are.Now, on the set itself. I've never been a huge fan of action movies, but after seeing Jean-Claude Van Damme in "Hard Target," I had to get every Van Damme movie I could get my hands on, and I've started to expand my collection by getting action movies starring other stars, and Arnold is one of them.When you buy this set, you should no what your in for. It's Arnold Schwarzenegger. That means cheesy one liners, bad acting, but full of action that will blow the speakers on your TV up.Commando: Arnold plays John Matrix, who's daughter is kidnapped by terrorists who want him to assasinate a president of a South American country. Arnold doesn't do what he's told and goes on an action filled ride to get his daughter back and kill every brute that gets in his way. An action cheese fest that'll have you coming back for seconds.Predator: Mercenaries in a South American jungle are hunted by an intergallactic hunter who makes mince meat out of each soldier one by one. Arnold goes on one with his most deadly opponent ever. A well put together sci-fi thiller that has great special effects for the time.True Lies: Arnold leads a double life. One as a computer salesman with a wife, and a daughter, and the other one as a secret agent who takes down terrorists. When his two lives collide together, him and his family are in for one hard time. An action extravaganza filled that has lots of laughs to make this movie a great Saturday night snack flick.Well, that's about it. Sadly, the DVDs have no special features, except a trailer for each. Well, you're getting three Arnold movies for the price of one, and you can't beat that. In conclusion, if you're worried about not getting this, don't worry, these movies will not be in fullscreen.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Once again, FOX deceives us with non-anamorphic copies while the box AND the individual cases clearly state "anamorphic widescreen". Before FOX got hold of MGM/UA releases they were at least marked either "WIDECREEN 16x9" or "LETTERBOX" so you knew if it was anamorphic or not. Now they are all marked "WIDESCREEN" and the aspect ratio with no anamorphic designation even if they are! The recent Bob Hope and Elvis movie legends collections are examples where some were and some not but you didn't know until you popped them in the player. Good thing I got this VERY cheap but this kind of deceptive (or downright false) packaging is inexcusable.
summary: It's True and I Ain't Lyin'

reviewText: Why can't FOX simply come up with an anniversary edition or other double-dip disc that has a TRUE anamorphic transfer of True Lies? TL is probably my favorite Schwarzenegger flick, and has remained popular, so why does it get the crapola treatment from FOX? Once again, FOX, just give us an anamorphic widescreen version of True Lies on DVD, it can't be that difficult to accomplish!!!

reviewText: I LOVE ALL THREE MOVIES.  PREDITOR IS A GOOD ACTION FLICK.  COMMANDO IS A VERY GOOD ACTION MOVIE WITH ONE OF MY FAVORITE PEOPLE, ALYSSA MILANO.  TRUE LIES IS JUST PLAIN GREAT.  CUTE STORY LINE, GOOD ACTION AND GOOD ACTING..  TOM ARNOLD IS HILARIOUS AND JAIME LEE CURTIS IS ALWAYS GREAT IN ANYTHING.  I'D RECOMMEND THESE THREE TO EVERYBODY.  JUST PLAIN GOOD.
